title: 114_hr5739
content: The "Help End Assault Rifle Tragedies (HEART) Act of 2016" prohibits the transfer of machine guns or semiautomatic assault weapons to individuals under the age of 16. The "HEART Act of 2016" prohibits transferring machine guns or semiautomatic assault weapons to individuals under 16 years old, including temporary transfers for target shooting or on a firing range. The act defines a semiautomatic assault weapon as specified types of rifles. The "HEART Act of 2016" prohibits transferring machine guns or semiautomatic assault weapons to individuals under 16 years old. Semiautomatic assault weapons are defined as rifles with specific features like detachable magazines, pistol grips, and grenade launchers. The "HEART Act of 2016" prohibits transferring machine guns or semiautomatic assault weapons to individuals under 16 years old. Semiautomatic assault weapons include rifles with features like detachable magazines, pistol grips, and barrel shrouds that can accelerate the rate of fire without converting them into machine guns. This also applies to semiautomatic pistols with threaded barrels, second pistol grips, barrel shrouds, detachable magazines outside the grip, or a semiautomatic version of an automatic firearm. Additionally, semiautomatic pistols with fixed magazines that hold more than 10 rounds, and semiautomatic shotguns with folding, telescoping, or detachable stocks or pistol grips are also restricted. The curr_chunk lists prohibited features for rifles, shotguns, and pistols, including pistol grips, fixed magazines over 5 rounds, detachable magazines, forward grips, grenade launchers, rocket launchers, and shotguns with revolving cylinders. It also specifies banned rifles like AK types, Saiga AK, and MAADI AK47. The curr_chunk lists prohibited AR types, including AR-10, AR-15, Armalite M15, Barrett REC7, Beretta AR-70, Bushmaster ACR, Colt Match Target Rifles, DoubleStar AR rifles, and DPMS Tactical Rifles. The curr_chunk lists additional prohibited rifles, including Heckler & Koch MR556, Olympic Arms, Remington R-15, Rock River Arms LAR-15, Sig Sauer SIG516, Sig Sauer MCX, Smith & Wesson M&P15, Stag Arms AR, and Sturm, Ruger & Co. SR556 rifles, as well as Barrett M107A1, Barrett M82A1, Beretta CX4 Storm, Calico Liberty Series, CETME Sporter, Daewoo K-1, K-2, Max 1, Max 2, AR 100, AR 110C, and Fabrique Nationale/FN Herstal FAL, LAR, 22. The curr_chunk lists additional prohibited rifles, including Fabrique Nationale/FN Herstal FAL, LAR, 22 FNC, 308 Match, L1A1 Sporter, PS90, SCAR, FS2000, Feather Industries AT-9, Galil Model AR, Model ARM, Hi-Point Carbine, HK-91, HK-93, HK-94, HK-PSG-1, HK USC, Kel-Tec Sub-2000, SU-16, RFB, SIG AMT, SIG PE-57, Sig Sauer SG 550, Sig Sauer SG 551, Springfield Armory SAR-48, Steyr AUG, Sturm, Ruger Mini-14 Tactical Rife M-14/20CF, and all Thompson rifles. The curr_chunk lists additional prohibited rifles, including Thompson T150D, T1B, T1B100D, T1B50D, T1BSB, T1-C, T1D, T1SB, T5, T5100D, TM1, TM1C, UMAREX UZI Rifle, UZI Mini Carbine, UZI Model A Carbine, UZI Model B Carbine, Valmet M62S, M71S, M78, Vector Arms UZI Type, Weaver Arms Nighthawk, Wilkinson Arms Linda Carbine. The curr_chunk lists prohibited pistols including AK-47 types like Centurion 39, Draco, HCR, IO Inc. Hellpup, Krinkov, Mini Draco, Yugo Krebs Krink, and AR-15 types like American Spirit, Bushmaster Carbon 15, DoubleStar Corporation. The curr_chunk lists additional prohibited pistols including DoubleStar Corporation AR pistol, DPMS AR-15 pistol, Olympic Arms AR-15 pistol, Rock River Arms LAR 15 pistol, Calico Liberty pistols, DSA SA58 PKP FAL pistol, Encom MP-9 and MP-45, Heckler & Koch model SP-89 pistol, Intratec AB-10, TEC-22 Scorpion, TEC-9, TEC-DC9, Kel-Tec PLR 16 pistol, and various MAC types. The curr_chunk lists prohibited shotguns including Franchi LAW-12, SPAS 12, and IZHMASH Saiga 12 types. The curr_chunk amends penalties under Section 924(a)(2) of title 18, United States Code by adding a new subsection (aa). The effective date of these amendments is also specified. The amendments made by this section will apply to conduct after 180 days from the enactment of this Act.
